intro: Solenostemon autranii, commonly known as the Cape York balsam, is a flowering plant native to northern Australia. It belongs to the family Linderniaceae and is characterized by its erect, herbaceous stems and opposite leaves. The plant produces small, tubular flowers that are typically pale purple or white, arranged in clusters at the ends of the branches. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in coastal or wetland habitats. Solenostemon autranii is known for its ornamental value and is sometimes cultivated for its attractive foliage and flowering display.
